SEARCH
Module com.DominionDMS.SnakeGame
Package com.DominionDMS.SnakeGame.View

Class GameView

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
com.DominionDMS.SnakeGame.View.GameView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class GameView extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
This class represents the visual aspect of the Snake game. It handles the rendering of the game components such as the snake, food, bombs, and the game environment. It also manages the pause button ,pause and end game menus.
Author:
Dominion Aromolaran-modified(Play and GameFrame)

  • Method Details

    • initialise

      public void initialise(GameController controller, FoodModel fmodel, SnakeModel smodel)
      Initializes the game view with necessary components and models.
      Parameters:
      controller - The game controller.
      fmodel - The food model.
      smodel - The snake model.

    • getSnakeHead

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getSnakeHead()
      Retrieves the current image of the snake's head.
      Returns:
      The Image object representing the snake's head.

    • getPauseMenu

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getPauseMenu()
      Retrieves the pause menu VBox.
      Returns:
      The VBox object representing the pause menu.

    • getEndMenu

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getEndMenu()
      Retrieves the end game menu VBox.
      Returns:
      The VBox object representing the end game menu.

    • setSnakeHead

      public void setSnakeHead(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      Sets a new image for the snake's head.
      Parameters:
      image - The new Image object for the snake's head.

    • resetHead

      public void resetHead()
      Resets the image of the snake's head to the original image.

    • getSnakeBody

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getSnakeBody()
      Retrieves the current image of the snake's body.
      Returns:
      The Image object representing the snake's body.

    • getBombs

      public BombModel getBombs()
      Retrieves the bomb model used in the game.
      Returns:
      The bomb model.

    • setUpTheme1

      public void setUpTheme1()
      Sets up the game view for theme 1(Summer), including background and snake images.

    • setUpTheme2

      public void setUpTheme2()
      Sets up the game view for theme 2(Christmas), including background and snake images.

    • setUpTheme3

      public void setUpTheme3()
      Sets up the game view for theme 3(Halloween), including background and snake images.

    • setUpLevel1

      public void setUpLevel1()
      Sets up the game environment for level 1. This level does not include bombs. The method also calls refocus to ensure the UI elements are properly aligned.

    • setUpLevel2

      public void setUpLevel2()
      Sets up the game environment for level 2. This level includes a predefined number of bombs as specified in Constants.LEVEL2_BOMB_NUM. The method also calls refocus to ensure the UI elements are properly aligned.

    • setUpLevel3

      public void setUpLevel3()
      Sets up the game environment for level 3. This level includes a higher number of bombs as specified in Constants.LEVEL3_BOMB_NUM for increased difficulty. The method also calls refocus to ensure the UI elements are properly aligned.

    • refocus

      public void refocus()
      Refocuses the game view to handle user input and updates visuals.

    • paint

      public void paint(boolean alive)
      Paints the game components on the canvas, including the snake, food, and bombs.
      Parameters:
      alive - Boolean indicating if the snake is alive.

    • drawSnake

      public void drawSnake(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws the snake on the canvas based on its current position and state.
      Parameters:
      gc - The graphics context for drawing on the canvas.

    • drawBombs

      public void drawBombs(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws bombs on the game canvas. This method iterates through the bomb list and renders each bomb at its respective position on the game field.
      Parameters:
      gc - GraphicsContext for drawing on the canvas.

    • draw

      public void draw(javafx.scene.image.Image image, int x, int y)
      Draws an image on the canvas at the specified x and y coordinates.
      Parameters:
      image - The image to be drawn.
      x - The x-coordinate on the canvas where the image will be placed.
      y - The y-coordinate on the canvas where the image will be placed.

    • drawScore

      public void drawScore(SnakeModel snakeModel)
      Renders the current score of the snake model on the game canvas.
      Parameters:
      snakeModel - The snake model containing the current score to be displayed.
